controller.classes

Class GameData

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.classes.GameData

  • public class GameData
extends java.lang.Object
    CS252 Object-Oriented Programming
    GameData Class. Used to store all data used by the game, and is manipulated by GameLoop.
    Author:
    George Kokiadis csd3962@csd.uoc.gr

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Deck g_Deck 
      (package private) Player g_Player1 
      (package private) Player g_Player2 
      private Game gameWindow
      Game Window

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameData(boolean loadFromFile, Game gameWindow)
      When the game is Constructed, the players get a name, their values set to default values, their cards given, and each player then gets the option to pick what destination cards they wish to keep.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void giveCards(Player p)
      Gives default cards to player
      Pre Conditions : Players are set correctly
      Post Conditions : Every player's hand is full of valid cards.
      private Player initializePlayer()
      Initializes a player, and pops up a window to ask for input for his name.
      private Player initializePlayer(java.lang.String name)
      Initialized a player with the specified string as a name
      Pre Conditions : A valid String is given as a name
      Post Conditions : Returns a valid constructed Player object.
      private void intializeDeck()
      Initializes the Deck
      Pre Conditions : None
      Post Conditions : Creates a valid Deck Object and passes it to g_Deck
      private void Load()
      Loads values from a file
      Pre Conditions : Game Loop is not running
      Post Conditions : Loads values from a file and creates a GameData from it
      private void playerPicksDestinationCards(Player p)
      Opens a dialogue window and asks the player which cards does he want to keep.
      void Save()
      Saves the Game Data to a file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameData

        public GameData(boolean loadFromFile,
                Game gameWindow)
        When the game is Constructed, the players get a name, their values set to default values, their cards given, and each player then gets the option to pick what destination cards they wish to keep. After that, GameLoop Takes over.
        Parameters:
        loadFromFile - Pick wether to load from a file or not
        gameWindow - Window the game is played in

    • Method Detail

      • Save

        public void Save()
        Saves the Game Data to a file.
        Pre Conditions : Game Loop is Running
        Post Conditions : Creates a valid save file

      • Load

        private void Load()
        Loads values from a file
        Pre Conditions : Game Loop is not running
        Post Conditions : Loads values from a file and creates a GameData from it

      • initializePlayer

        private Player initializePlayer()
        Initializes a player, and pops up a window to ask for input for his name.
        Pre Conditions : None
        Post Conditions : Returns a valid constructed Player object.
        Returns:
        Constructed player object

      • initializePlayer

        private Player initializePlayer(java.lang.String name)
        Initialized a player with the specified string as a name
        Pre Conditions : A valid String is given as a name
        Post Conditions : Returns a valid constructed Player object.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the player
        Returns:
        Constructed player object

      • intializeDeck

        private void intializeDeck()
        Initializes the Deck
        Pre Conditions : None
        Post Conditions : Creates a valid Deck Object and passes it to g_Deck

      • giveCards

        private void giveCards(Player p)
        Gives default cards to player
        Pre Conditions : Players are set correctly
        Post Conditions : Every player's hand is full of valid cards.
        Parameters:
        p - Player to give the cards to

      • playerPicksDestinationCards

        private void playerPicksDestinationCards(Player p)
        Opens a dialogue window and asks the player which cards does he want to keep.
        Pre Conditions : Player p is a valid player object
        Post Conditions : Opens a dialogue window for the player to pick the destination cards he wishes, and puts these cards in his hand
        Parameters:
        p - Player to pick cards
